title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix

title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: what is commonly called human. It was all too different. However, he
title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

author: Flint, Homer Eon

title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: case, however, he could occasionally glimpse two loose parts of the
title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: machine, flapping and swaying oddly from time to time within the
title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: range of the observer, and at the front. Nothing was done about it.
title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: do the driving.

author: Flint, Homer Eon

title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix

author: Flint, Homer Eon

author: Flint, Homer Eon

title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: swiftest glance at what, he thought rather vaguely, was a great
title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: understanding.

author: Flint, Homer Eon

author: Flint, Homer Eon

title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

author: Flint, Homer Eon

title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

author: Flint, Homer Eon

title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix

title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

author: Flint, Homer Eon

author: Flint, Homer Eon

title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: slope into the pit. His engine was quite stopped; like Smith, the
title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

author: Flint, Homer Eon

author: Flint, Homer Eon

author: Flint, Homer Eon

author: Flint, Homer Eon

title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

author: Flint, Homer Eon

author: Flint, Homer Eon

title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: saw.

author: Flint, Homer Eon

title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix

title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix

author: Flint, Homer Eon

title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

author: Flint, Homer Eon

title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

author: Flint, Homer Eon

author: Flint, Homer Eon

author: Flint, Homer Eon

author: Flint, Homer Eon

author: Flint, Homer Eon

author: Flint, Homer Eon

author: Flint, Homer Eon

author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: mysterious periscope so as to take it all in, and the geologist was

text: able to watch his fill. Whereupon he became converted to a new idea:
title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

author: Flint, Homer Eon

author: Flint, Homer Eon

author: Flint, Homer Eon

author: Flint, Homer Eon

title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

author: Flint, Homer Eon

title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

author: Flint, Homer Eon

title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

author: Flint, Homer Eon

title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix

author: Flint, Homer Eon

title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix

author: Flint, Homer Eon

author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: machine. The sun was shining upon it in such a fashion that its

author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: range.

author: Flint, Homer Eon

author: Flint, Homer Eon

title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix

author: Flint, Homer Eon

title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: volplane, presently coming to another nausea-producing stop. Once
title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

author: Flint, Homer Eon

title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

author: Flint, Homer Eon

author: Flint, Homer Eon

author: Flint, Homer Eon

author: Flint, Homer Eon

title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix

text: watch out for her. This was true; Billie learned that every bee on

text: the planet had been told. And so Cunora silently backed away, an
title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix

text: inch at a time, until it was safe to turn and run.

text: On another occasion Rolla surprised a big drone bee, just as she
title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: bent to take a drink of water from a stream. The insect had been out
title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: of her sight, on the other side of a boulder. It rose with an angry
title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: buzz as she bent down; a few feet away from her it hung in the air,
title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: apparently scrutinizing her to make sure that she was one of the
title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: runaways. Her heart leaped to her mouth. Suppose they were reported!
title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: She made a lightninglike grab at the thing, and very nearly caught
title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: it. Straight up it shot, taken by surprise, and dashed blindly into
title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: a ledge of rock which hung overhead. For a second it floundered,
title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: forward, and with a vicious swing of a palm-leaf, which she always
title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix

author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: Before they had been free five days they came to an exceedingly
title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: serious conclusion: that it was only a question of time until they
title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: were caught. Sooner or later they must be forced to return; they
title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: could not hope to dodge bees much longer. When Rolla fully realized
title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: this she turned gravely to the younger girl.
title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: "Methinks the time has come for us to make a choice, Cunora. Which
title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: shall it be: live as we have been living for the past four days,
title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: perils on the edge of the world?"
title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: Cunora dropped the piece of stone she had been inspecting and
title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: shivered with fear. "A dreadful choice ye offer, Rolla! Think of the
title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: horrible beasts we must encounter!"
title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: "Ye mean"--corrected the philosophical one--"ye mean, the beasts
title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: which men SAY they have seen. Tell me; hast ever seen such thyself?
title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: Many times hast thou been near the edge, I know."
title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: The girl shook her head. "Nay; not I. Yet these beasts must be,
title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: Rolla; else why should all men tell of them?"
title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: "I note," remarked Rolla thoughtfully, "that each man tells of
title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: seeing a different sort of beast. Perchance they were all but lies."
title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: However, it was Cunora's fear of capture, rather than her faith in
title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: Rolla's reasoning, which drove the girl to the north. For to the
title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: north they traveled, a matter of some two weeks; and not once did
title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: they dare relax their vigilance. Wherever they went, there was
title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: vegetation of some sort, and wherever there was vegetation bees were
title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: likely to be found. By the time the two weeks were over, the women
title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: were in a state of near-hysteria, from the nervous strain of it all.
title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: Moreover, both suffered keenly for want of cereals, to which they
title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: were accustomed; they were heartily tired of such fruits and nuts as
title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: they were able to pick up without exposing themselves.
title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: One morning before daybreak they came to the upper end of a long,
title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: narrow valley--one which paralleled their own, by the way--and as
title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: they emerged from the plain into the foothills it was clear that
title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: they had reached a new type of country. There was comparatively
title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: little brush; and with every step the rockiness increased. By dawn
title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: they were on the edge of a plateau; back of them stretched the
title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: inhabited country; ahead, a haze-covered expanse. Nothing but rocks
title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: was about them.
title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: "Ye are sure that we had best keep on?" asked Cunora uneasily.
title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: Rolla nodded, slowly but positively. "It is best. Back of us lies
title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: certain capture. Ahead--we know not what; but at least there is a
title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: chance!"
title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: Nevertheless, both hesitated before starting over the plateau. Each
title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: gazed back longingly over the home of their kind; and for a moment
title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: Holla's resolution plainly faltered. She hesitated; Cunora made a
title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: move as though to return. And at that instant their problem was
title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: decided for them.
title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: A large drone passed within six feet of them. Both heard the buzz,
title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: and whirled about to see the bee darting frantically out of reach.
title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: At a safe distance it paused, as though to make sure of its find,
title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: then disappeared down the valley. They had been located!
title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: "We have no choice now!" cried Rolla, speaking above a whisper for
title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: the first time in weeks. "On, as fast as ye can, Cunora!"
title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: The two sped over the rocks, making pretty good time considering the
title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: loads they carried. Each had a good-sized goatskin full of various
title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: dried fruits and nuts, also a gourd not so full. In fact, it had
title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: been some while since they had had fresh water. Cunora was further
title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: weighed down by some six pounds of dried rabbit meat; the animals
title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: had been caught in snares. Both, however, discarded their palm
title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: leaves; they would be of no further use now.
title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: And thus they fled, knowing that they had, at most, less than a day
title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: before the drone would return with enough soldiers to compel
title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: obedience. For the most part, the surface was rough granite, with
title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: very little sign of erosion. There was almost no water; both women
title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: showed intense joy when they found a tiny pool of it standing in a
title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: crevasse. They filled their gourds as well as their stomachs.
title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: A few steps farther on, and the pair stepped out of the shallow
title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: gully in which they had been walking. Immediately they were exposed
title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: to a very strong and exceedingly cold wind, such as seemed to
title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: surprise them in no way, but compelled both to actually lean against
title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: its force. Moreover, although this pressure was all from the left,
title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: it proved exceedingly difficult to go on. Their legs seemed made of
title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: lead, and their breathing was strangely labored. This, also,
title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: appeared to be just what they had expected.
title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: Presently, however, they found another slight depression in the
title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: rocks; and sheltered from the wind, made a little better progress
title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: ahead. It was bitter cold, however; only the violence of their
title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: exercise could make them warm enough to stand it. All in all, the
title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: two were considerably over three hours in making the last mile; they
title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: had to stop frequently to rest. The only compensating thing was
title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: their freedom from worry; the bees would not bother them where the
title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: wind was so strong. So long as they could keep on the move they were
title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: safe.
title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: But what made it worse was the steadily increasing difficulty of
title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: moving their legs. For, although the surface continued level, they
title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: seemed to be CLIMBING now, where before they had simply walked. It
title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: was just as though the plateau had changed into a mountain, and they
title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: were ascending it; only, upon looking back, nothing but
title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: comparatively flat rock met the gaze. What made them lean forward so
title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: steeply anyhow?
title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: Rolla seemed to think it all very ordinary. She was more concerned
title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: about the wind, to which they had become once more exposed as they
title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: reached the end of the rift. On they pressed, five or six steps at
title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: each attempt, stopping to rest twice the length of time they
title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: actually traveled. It was necessary now to cling to the rock with
title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: both hands, and once Cunora lost her grip, so that she would have
title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: been blown to one side, or else have slipped backward, had not Rolla
title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: grasped her heel and held her until she could get another hand-hold.
title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: "Courage!" gasped Rolla. Perspiration was streaming down her face,
title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: despite the bitter cold of the wind; her hands trembled from the
title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: strain she was undergoing. "Courage, Cunora! It be not much
title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: farther!"
title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: On they strove. Always it seemed as though they were working upward
title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: as well as onward, although the continued flatness of the surface
title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: argued obstinately against this. Also, the sun remained in the same
title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: position relative to the rocks; if they were climbing, it should
title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: have appeared overhead. What did it mean?
title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: Finally Rolla saw, about a hundred yards farther on, something which
title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: caused her to shout: "Almost there, Cunora!"
title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: The younger girl could not spare breath enough to reply. They
title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: struggled on in silence.
title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: Now they were down on their hands and knees. Before half the hundred
title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: yards was covered, they were flat on their faces, literally clawing
title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: their way upward and onward. Had the wind increased in violence in
title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: proportion as the way grew harder, they could never have made it,
title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: they dared not return drove them on; that, and the possibility of
title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: they had left behind.
title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: The last twenty feet was the most extraordinary effort that any
title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: human had ever been subjected to. They had to take turns in
title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: negotiating the rock; one would creep a few inches on, get a good
title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: hold, and brace herself against the wind, while the other, crawling

author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: alongside, used her as a sort of a crutch. Their fingers were
title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: bleeding and their finger-nails cracked from the rock and cold; the
title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: same is equally true of their toes. Had it been forty feet instead
title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: of twenty--
title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: The rocks ended there. Beyond was nothing but sky; even this was not
title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: like what they were used to, but was very nearly black. Two more
title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: spurts, and Rolla threw one hand ahead and caught the edge of the
title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: her nostrils.
title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: They rested a minute or two, then looked at one another in mute
title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

author: Flint, Homer Eon

title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: of rock was black as night. From side to side the ridge extended,
title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: like a jagged knife edge on a prodigious scale; it seemed infinite
title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: in extent. Behind them--that is, at their feet--lay the
title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: stone-covered expanse they had just traversed; ahead of them there
title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: was--nothingness itself.
title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: Cunora shook with fear and cold. "Let us not go on, Rolla!" she
title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: whimpered. "I like not the looks of this void; it may contain all
title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: sorts of beasts. I--I am afraid!" She began to sob convulsively.
title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: Rolla peered into the darkness. Nothing whatever was to be seen. It
title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: was as easy to imagine enemies as friends; easier in fact. What
title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: might not the unknown hold for them?
title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: "We cannot stay here," spoke Rolla, with what energy her condition
title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: would permit. "We could not--hold on. Nor can we return now; They
title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: would surely find us!"
title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: But Cunora's courage, which had never faltered in the face of
title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: familiar dangers, was not equal to the unknown. She wailed: "Rolla!
title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: A little way back--a hollow in the rock! 'Tis big enough to shelter
title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: me! I would--rather stay there than--go on!"
title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: "Ye would rather die there, alone!"
title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: Cunora hid her face. "Let me have half the food! I can go back to
title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: the pool--for water! And maybe," hopefully--"maybe They will give

author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: up the search in time."
title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: "Aye," from Rolla, bitterly. "And in time Dulnop will die, if we do
title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: nothing for him--and for Corrus!"
title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: Cunora fell to sobbing again. "I cannot help it! I am--afraid!"
title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: Rolla scarcely heard. An enormous idea had just occurred to her. She
title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: had told the girl to think of Dulnop and Corrus; but was it not
title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: equally true that they should think of all the other humans, their
title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: fellow slaves, each of whom had suffered nearly as much? Was not the
title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: fire equally precious to them all?
title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: She started to explain this to the girl, then abruptly gave it up.
title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: It was no use; Cunora's mind was not strong enough to take the step.
title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: Rolla fairly gasped as she realized, as no Sanusian had realized
title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: before, that she had been given the responsibility of rescuing A
title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: Fire she must have! And since she could not, dared not, seek it

text: here, she must try the other side of the world. And she would have

title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: "So be it!" she said loudly in a strange voice. "Ye stay here and
title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: wait, Cunora! I go on!"
title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: And for fear her resolution would break down, she immediately crept

author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: over the edge. She clung to the rock as though expecting to be

author: Flint, Homer Eon

author: Flint, Homer Eon

author: Flint, Homer Eon

title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

author: Flint, Homer Eon

title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: would gaze upon the other again. Next moment, with Cunora's
title: The Devolutionist and the Emancipatrix
